about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

about.name: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

hasPart.assesses: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? | Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

answerExplanation.text: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

comment.text: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? | When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

hasPart.name: As you approach the top of a hill, you should:

about.name: As you approach the top of a hill, you should:

hasPart.assesses: As you approach the top of a hill, you should: | As you approach the top of a hill, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may not know what is on the other side of a hill or just around a curve, even if you have driven the road many times. If a vehicle is stalled just out of sight on the roadway, you must be able to stop. Whenever you come to a hill or curve, adjust your speed so you can stop if necessary.

answerExplanation.text: You may not know what is on the other side of a hill or just around a curve, even if you have driven the road many times. If a vehicle is stalled just out of sight on the roadway, you must be able to stop. Whenever you come to a hill or curve, adjust your speed so you can stop if necessary.

hasPart.name: If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your:

about.name: If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your:

hasPart.assesses: If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your: | If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must turn on your headlights any time conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles. Other drivers may have trouble seeing you, too.

answerExplanation.text: You must turn on your headlights any time conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles. Other drivers may have trouble seeing you, too.

hasPart.name: Prior to entering a curve:
hasPart.assesses: Prior to entering a curve: | Prior to entering a curve: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

answerExplanation.text: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

comment.text: Prior to entering a curve: | You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

hasPart.name: This sign tells a driver that:

about.name: This sign tells a driver that:

hasPart.assesses: This sign tells a driver that: | This sign tells a driver that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

answerExplanation.text: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

hasPart.name: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

about.name: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

hasPart.assesses: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? | Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

suggestedAnswer.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall

comment.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall

suggestedAnswer.text: A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall

comment.text: A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall

suggestedAnswer.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

comment.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

acceptedAnswer.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

comment.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

answerExplanation.text: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

comment.text: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? | Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.
